author: Fuseworks Media
title: New director appointed to council CCO board in Rotorua
text:
Fuseworks Media Friday, 2 October, 2015 - 07:37 
Rotorua Lakes Council has appointed John McRae to the board of Rotorua Contracting Ltd, the council controlled organisation (CCO) that was formerly the council’s Castlecorp business unit. 
Rotorua-based Mr McRae is a partner in accounting and financial services consultancy Deloitte, and brings more than 15 years experience as a CEO and director to Rotorua Contracting’s board room. 
He has a wide range of public and private sector experience and currently works primarily in the areas of governance and management. 
He is also Rotorua Chamber of Commerce president. 
Mr McRae said Rotorua Contracting has a "very competent team" which he was keen to join. 
"There’s plenty of work ahead, but it’s a very committed organisation that’s capable of serving the city with pride." 
Mr McRae’s appointment as a director was made last night (Thursday 1 October) at a meeting of Rotorua Lakes Council. He joins previously appointed board members Leith Comber (chairman), Ian Boyd, Jan Bolton and Israel Hawkins. 
Rotorua Contracting is responsible for maintenance of much of the council’s infrastructure, including water and sewerage systems, parks and gardens, rubbish collection and cleaning services. The CCO also maintains the council vehicle fleet, cemeteries and crematorium.
